ygData.subject: Re: [EverQuest] Hi...I am looking for a EQ entusiast (addict) for a TV Interview
ygData.msgSnippet: ... Sure, *you* are flaming, but the original poster flamed no-one... just made a simple request to interview an EQ player for a TV program... How is that
ygData.messageBody:
David Langille wrote:
> Matthew Bond <mattgbond@...> wrote:
> David Langille wrote:
>> u are so gonna be banned!
>
> a) Why?
>
>
> Blatent flaming.

Sure, *you* are flaming, but the original poster flamed no-one... just
made a simple request to interview an EQ player for a TV program... How
is that either Flaming or Trolling?

> b) Try to avoid top posting... makes it harder to follow threads
>
>
> It's what I ususally do, if I'm replying like I am now I reply like I
> am right now though.

Hmmm, seems you haven't got your mail reader set up to indicate quoted
material in a plai-text email... perhaps you could set it up so that you
conform to the established standard of indenting quoted text with a >
... makes it easiet to follow who said what.

> c) More likely he will be unable to get an EQ 'addict' to drag
> themselves away from the computer long enough to be interviewed...
>
>
> Yeah.
>
> And like Vash says, why do they only attack everquest, because it's
> the most popular.

Where did he attack EQ? You are *assuming* that the TV program will
focus on the recent news stories regarding EQ, but you, as yet, have
nothing to base that claim on.

Matt
